-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Tutorial for the lens library
--   
--   This is a basic tutorial that you can use to get started with the
--   <tt>lens</tt> library. This tutorial covers:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The motivation behind the <tt>lens</tt> library</li>
--   <li>How to use the library for the most common use cases</li>
--   <li>How to interpret type errors</li>
--   <li>Basic familiarity with how lenses work under the hood</li>
--   </ul>
@package lens-tutorial
@version 1.0.0


-- | This <tt>lens</tt> tutorial targets Haskell beginners and assumes only
--   basic familiarity with Haskell. By the end of this tutorial you
--   should:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>understand what problems the <tt>lens</tt> library
--   solves,<ul><li>know when it is appropriate to use the <tt>lens</tt>
--   library,</li><li>be proficient in the most common <tt>lens</tt>
--   idioms,</li><li>understand the drawbacks of using lenses,
--   and:</li><li>know where to look if you wish to learn more advanced
--   tricks.</li></ul>If you would like to follow along with these
--   examples, just import this module:</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <pre>
--   $ ghci
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; import Control.Lens.Tutorial
--   </pre>
module Control.Lens.Tutorial
instance Show Point
instance Show Atom
instance Show Molecule
instance Functor Pair
instance Foldable Pair
instance Traversable Pair
